body.name: SHARKPOP Doorbell Camera Wireless, WiFi Video Doorbell, Free Ring Chime Included, Indoor/Outdoor Surveillance with Smart Human Detection, 2-Way Audio, Night Vision, Cloud Storage, Live View

features: [2.4 GHz Wi-Fi & Encrypted Cloud Storage] The Paso doorbell camera is compatible with 2.4Ghz Wi-Fi, guaranteeing fast and reliable connectivity for seamless performance. Enjoy AES-128 encrypted cloud storage through an optional subscription plan (available for purchase separately). Take advantage of a 30-day free trial to explore the convenience of the subscription plan, which enables you to record, review, and share your videos securely.
[Smart AI Human detection & Real-time Alerts ] Accurately distinguishes between humans and other objects to reduce false recordings, sending you instant notifications when human movement is detected.
[Night vision & Wide-angle View] Built-in infrared lights and a smart infrared sensor provide clear images at night, while the wide-angle design ensures comprehensive front door coverage.

[Easy Installation & Free Chime Included] Quickly and easily install the 100% wire-free doorbell camera with adhesive tape or screws. The package includes an free indoor chime that rings along with the outdoor doorbell camera.
[Two Way Audio & Live View] Monitor your front door and communicate with visitors anytime, anywhere through your smartphone.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Doorbell Camera Wireless, WiFi Video Doorbell, Chime Included

Two-way Talk Engage in conversations with visitors anytime, anywhere. IR Night Vison Monitor your doorstep clearly even during nighttime hours. Smart AI Human Detection Get notified on your mobile device when human movement is detected, avoiding unnecessary alerts. Share Device with Family It supports up to 8 users to access the doorbell. Share the device with your family, so everyone gets access.

With Doorbell Chime Elevate your experience with the added convenience of a doorbell chime, easily installed in your preferred areas like the living room, kitchen. Wireless Design Designed for 2.4G Wi-Fi (5G Wi-Fi not supported), ensure you never miss a visitor, no matter where you are. Weatherproof Resilience With an IP65 dustproof and waterproof rating, this doorbell camera is designed to withstand a variety of weather conditions, delivering security. Secure Cloud Storage Access your videos anytime, even if your doorbell goes offline, is stolen, or damaged, ensuring your footage remains within reach. (Sold separately)

Installation and Usage Tips Easily set up your doorbell using the included adhesive tape or two screws. What's in the box: Doorbell Camera x 1, Rechargeable Battery x 2, USB Indoor Chime x 1, Adhesive Tape x 1, Screw Pack x 1, USB Charging Cablex 1, User Manual x 1

How many days does the doorbell camera work on a full charge? Typically, you can expect the doorbell camera's battery to last 1 to 3 months on one charge, but it varies with the number of recordings. More frequent recordings and regular Live View usage will deplete the battery faster. Is remote access to the doorbell camera available via a smartphone application? Absolutely, you have the capability to view the video via the Aiwit app. Does this doorbell camera let you store videos up in the cloud? Videos are saved only with a cloud service subscription, which includes a trial period. Should the service meet your needs, the subscription begins automatically after the trial, but cancellation is free within the trial period if you’re dissatisfied Can the doorbell camera connect to 5GHz Wi-Fi networks? This doorbell camera is designed for 2.4G Wi-Fi only. Split your Wi-Fi into two - one for 2.4GHz and another for 5GHz. Ensure they're differently named for the camera to connect correctly. Do I need an SD card for the doorbell camera? This doorbell camera doesn't support SD cards. It uses cloud storage, which you can try for free.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product - Value for money
reviews.reviewText: I am in love with the video doorbell and find it value for money. It is very easy to install and pair with your wifi network and phone. The included chime is a bonus and it pairs easily with the bell. Quality of video is good both in day and night. Tried the 2 way audio communication and no complaints with it so far. I find the product a very good addition especially for the price and features it provides.Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I haven’t had no problems or complaints about this video doorbell it’s works great the picture isn’t bad. The doorbell noise is loud and I can hear it all over my house. It’s so easy to set up. The annual fee for isn’t bad either if you wish to purchase. Over all great product so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install!
reviews.reviewText: This camera was very easy to install. It shows up very clear with great quality. I love the fact that I can talk to my visitor from my phone. I give it 5 stars. Great price and Great Quality.

reviews.reviewerName: Cheap but worth it! Cheap but worth it!
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and well worth it!
reviews.reviewText: I received my doorbell the very next day after placing the order. It’s very easy to install and for $30 the camera quality is really nice— not blurry at all. The only thing is you’ll need to adjust your motion sensitivity or else you’ll keep getting notifications like the tree branches swinging due to wind. Other than that it’s great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy set up
reviews.reviewText: We got this today and the kids have played with it more than anything. The door bell is now a bit annoying lol. I love how it alerts me right away of people. Only thing is I wish we had options of door bell sound. We love the quality it is extremely clear picture and sound

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This Doorbell Camera works great, I use in my front door, the cámara quality is very good for the price and also the audio. I love the smart human detection is very helpful for me because I have a in home business. The battery last like about a month and is rechargeable, they send you an email when is low. I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This camera door bell is amazing , the definition on the camera is really good , its motion sensors work really good when anyone comes to the door or walks by and can be adjusted as well. I would recommend buying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's only been a day,
reviews.reviewText: So I'll edit my review if anything new pops up that didn't present as a problem initially.Let's start with setup ... Quick and easy. So easy, that I was half awake and struggling to read after a long day and still managed to get into connected just fine.As far as the doorbell portion goes, I can't speak to that. We have a built in doorbell already (we rent) so I didn't see a need to plug in a second one. BUT while testing it last night, if the doorbell is rang it will ring on your phone, and you have a timer to "answer". If you "pick up" it connects you to the camera so you can see who's there, and you can communicate via the microphone button at the bottom.Night vision - works surprisingly well for the price we paid. I really wasn't expecting super high quality, but this surpassed what I was expecting. Night vision is extremely clear.The microphone on it sounds like crap tbh. But again, look at the price point. It's only the sound that comes out of the doorbell. The sound it picks up is clear.Pretty wide range picture. You can play with the sensitivity in the settings, which will essentially effect how close/far away something needs to be to trigger the motion sensor. I've got it set on "standard" and it picks up motion from the middle of our driveway.The subscription itself is cheap in my opinion. It's about the same cost as the camera, for 6 months. It records at the first motion detection, and will stop recording when the motion stops.You have the ability to look at the camera any time from the app, which also tells you the battery level.The only negatives I see in this so far that may deter someone from buying it, is the fact it needs to be charged. Obviously since it's not hard wired it needs to get it's energy from somewhere, but you'd think the company would offer changeable battery packs (so you can charge and swap). Also there's somewhat of a lag in recording. When we were testing it, his movements vs what I was seeing were a second or two behind, but to me that's not the end of the world.For the price point it's an excellent choice. I got way more than I expected.I also want to note (it may be mentioned in the ad somewhere but I'm known for half reading that) this does NOT come with screws to mount it. It does however come with a sticky pad (like double sided mounting tape).
